intro: Psychotria mapourioides, commonly known as the Mapourioides Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptic leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals with a prominent corolla. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
